problem: Casey's shop class is making a golf trophy.  He has to paint $300$ dimples on a golf ball.  If it takes him $2$ seconds to paint one dimple, how many minutes will he need to do his job?
solution: At $2$ seconds per dimple, it takes $300 \times 2 = 600$ seconds to paint them.  Since there are $60$ seconds in a minute, he will need $600 \div 60 = \boxed{10}$ minutes.
